Learning Data Science

Data Science Workshops for the Enterprise

The mission of Learning Data Science is to empower organizations to grow their own Business Analysts, and Software Developers into Data Scientists through hands-on, technical workshops.

Workshops are designed to introduce concepts in Data Science in the Python programming language

What makes these workshops unique?

  • Emphasis on case studies
  • Friendly conceptual and visual explanations vs. mathmatical theory
  • Learning how to learn syntax straight from the documentation
  • Breadth of topics covered in accelerated time-span
  • Minimal prerequisites

What topics do workshops cover?

All workshops are done in Python. Workshop topics can be selected by the organization:

  • Data Wrangling
  • Introduction to Statistics
  • General Linear Modeling
  • Classification and Regression Trees
  • Ensembling Techniques
  • Machine Learning
  • Text Analytics
  • Predictive Model Evaluation
  • Logistic Regression
  • Cluster Analysis
  • Web Scraping
  • Data Visualization
  • Introduction to Python

What will I get out of this workshop?

  • Written description of key concepts with visual aids
  • Explanations of how to read the documentation for relevant packages
  • Coded examples along with interpretations associated with the mini-case study
  • Links to documentation and additional resources for continued learning

Who is the instructor?

Josiah Davis is a teacher, data scientist and consultant. Josiah is a former instructor of Data Science for a major accelerated learning program where he tied for receiving the highest student rating in the history of the course across all campuses.

As a data scientist, Josiah has provided consulting services to a wide range of high-profile clients including Department of Veteran Affairs, Genentech, Walmart, Pacific Gas and Electric, CVS Caremark, and First Republic Bank.

Technically, Josiah has professional experience in machine learning, survival analysis, general linear modeling, natural language processing, metric design, and visualization. Josiah is currently living in San Francisco with his wife and two daughters.

What are the prerequisites?

  • Advanced statistical or computer science knowledge is useful but not required.
  • All attendees must have a downloaded copy of the Anaconda distribution for Python 3.5 and the ability to execute code in a Jupyter notebook
  • Prior scripting experience in Python is beneficial but it is not necessary for these workshops
